meanings.definition: To pass a rope through a block or other object.
meanings.sent1: She was reeving the rope through the pulley.
meanings.sent2: The sailor was reeving the line through the cleat on the boat.
meanings.sent3: The monkey tried reeving the banana through the bars of the cage.
meanings.sent4: He was reeving his way through the maze of obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The weaver was reeving the colorful threads through the loom with skill.

meanings.sent1: She was reeving the needle through the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The spider was reeving its web in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef was reeving the ingredients together to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The dancers were reeving their movements seamlessly on stage.
meanings.sent5: The artist was reeving different colors together to form a beautiful painting.
